translated: Having made a garland,🔽I was walking along the street,
I saw the highest of ascetics,
with the Community of monks in front.
with both hands I raised it up
and offered it to the Buddha.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping with flowers.
there was a lord of the earth,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Mañjaripūjaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā mañjaripūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Mañjaripūjakattherassāpadānaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā mañjaripūjakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽mañjaripūjaka therassa apadānam sattama
translated: The Elder Mañjaripūjaka’s Birth Story, the seventh.
